topic: Deep dive: _json standard library module in Python 3.12+
prompt: Write a Python 3.12+ focused, accurate explainer for: Deep dive: _json standard library module in Python 3.12+

response_parsed.title: Deep Dive: json standard library module in Python 3.12+
response_parsed.summary: This explainer provides an in-depth look at the json standard library module in Python 3.12+, focusing on new features and improvements.
key_points: Enhanced JSON handling capabilities with added efficiency.
Improved support for JSON Web Tokens (JWT) and other JSON-based standards.
Better error handling and exception management during JSON parsing and serialization.
New functions like 'json.nasl_parser()' for parsing NaSL (Next-Generation Assembly Language).
Optimized performance in handling large JSON objects.
version_notes: Version 3.12 introduces new functionalities and optimizations for the json module.
For previous versions, please consult the respective documentation.
caveats: While the json module has been improved in Python 3.12+, it's essential to note that some specific use cases may still require third-party libraries for more advanced JSON handling.
Always ensure you are using the latest version of Python and the json library for the best performance and features.
